title: Netclean ProActive Incidents
descriptionMarkdown: This connector uses the Netclean Webhook (required) and Logic Apps to push data into Microsoft Sentinel Log Analytics

dataTypes.name: Netclean_Incidents_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Netclean_Incidents_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
Netclean_Incidents_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

instructionSteps.description:
>**NOTE:** The data connector relies on Azure Logic Apps to recive and push data to Log Analytics This might result in additional data ingestion costs.
 It's possible to test this without Logic Apps or NetClean Proactive see option 2

instructions.title: Option 1: deploy Logic app
instructions.description:
1.Search for and deploy the latest version of the NetClean Logic app 
 2.Modify it in accordance with the instructions found on my.netclean.com 
 Copy the HTTP POST URL 
 3. Add it to the webhook configuration in your NetClean ProActive Webconsole.

instructions.title: Option 2
instructions.description:
Ingest data using a api function. please use the script found on
 https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/logs/data-collector-api?tabs=powershell 
 replace the CustomerId and SharedKey values. 
 replace the data in $json variable to the sample data. 
 set the LogType varible to **Netclean_Incidents_CL** 
 run the script
